questions: How is a federal government different from the unitary form of government ? Why are federations preferred these days ?
answers: Difference :  Unitary government has only one level of government whereas a federal government has two or more levels of government.  In unitary government, government, the sub-units are subordinate to the centre, whereas in a federation, central government cannot encroach on the rights of state governments.  In unitary system, centre can order the sub-units which cannot happen in federation. A federation is preferred because :  It helps in making administration administration effective and efficient.  It helps to accommodate all diverse groups.

questions: How are the powers divided between the states and centre? Explain with examples.
answers: The three-fold distribution of legislative powers :  Union list : Union lists consist of 97 subjects. Concurrent list : Concurrent list consists of 47 subjects It includes subjects of common interest to both such as education, forest, trade unions, marriage, adoption and succession.
